Package gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters

Class FlyingMonster

java.lang.Object
gameobjects.GameObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.NonStaticObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters.Monster
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters.FlyingMonster
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Fly, MiniSteven, RedFly
public abstract class FlyingMonster
extends Monster
A FlyingMonster is a Monsters, it's mainly used because of it's unique ability to fly above things that are on the ground. So this class changes the way NonStaticObject checks if a move is legal.

To check what the variable from FlyingMonster are please refer to Monster , NonStaticObject and GameObject.

See Also:
Serialized Form

    Constructs a new FlyingMonster that can only attack on hand to hand, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean legalMove​(Vector2 position)
    Checks if the move is legal or not, it checks if the FlyingMonster collides with any wall or Door, if it is then it returns false, otherwise returns false.

  • Constructor Details

    • FlyingMonster

      public FlyingMonster​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, double speed, int damage, int health, Room room, int attackSpeed, double forwardDistance, double backwardDistance)
      Constructs a new FlyingMonster that can only attack on hand to hand, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

      Here forwardDistance, backwardDistance and shootingDistance are all the referring to the distance from the DistantMonster and the Hero.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new FlyingMonster
      size - the size of the new FlyingMonster
      imagePath - the image of the new FlyingMonster
      speed - the speed of the new FlyingMonster
      damage - the damage done by the new FlyingMonster
      health - the health of the new FlyingMonster
      room - the room the new FlyingMonster will be in
      attackSpeed - the speed to which the new FlyingMonster will attack on hand to hand
      forwardDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start moving forward
      backwardDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start moving backward

    • FlyingMonster

      public FlyingMonster​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, double speed, int damage, int health, Room room, int attackSpeed, double forwardDistance, double backwardDistance, double shootingDistance, double reach, int distantAttackSpeed)
      Constructs a new FlyingMonster that can distantly attack, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

      Here forwardDistance, backwardDistance and shootingDistance are all the referring to the distance from the DistantMonster and the Hero.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new FlyingMonster
      size - the size of the new FlyingMonster
      imagePath - the image of the new FlyingMonster
      speed - the speed of the new FlyingMonster
      damage - the damage done by the new FlyingMonster
      health - the health of the new FlyingMonster
      room - the room the new DistantMonster will be in
      attackSpeed - the speed to which the new FlyingMonster will attack on hand to hand
      forwardDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start moving forward
      backwardDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start moving backward
      shootingDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start shooting at the hero
      reach - the reach for the projectile shot by the new FlyingMonster
      distantAttackSpeed - the speed to which the new FlyingMonster will attack by shooting

    • FlyingMonster

      public FlyingMonster​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, double speed, int damage, int health, Room room, int attackSpeed, double forwardDistance, double backwardDistance, double shootingDistance, double reach, int distantAttackSpeed, java.util.List<java.lang.String> tearAnimationSprite, java.lang.String tearImagePath)
      Constructs a new FlyingMonster that can distantly attack, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

      Here forwardDistance, backwardDistance and shootingDistance are all the referring to the distance from the DistantMonster and the Hero.

      Here you can specify the projectile image and animation images that will be used.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new FlyingMonster
      size - the size of the new FlyingMonster
      imagePath - the image of the new FlyingMonster
      speed - the speed of the new FlyingMonster
      damage - the damage done by the new FlyingMonster
      health - the health of the new FlyingMonster
      room - the room the new DistantMonster will be in
      attackSpeed - the speed to which the new FlyingMonster will attack on hand to hand
      forwardDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start moving forward
      backwardDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start moving backward
      shootingDistance - the distance that the new FlyingMonster will start shooting at the hero
      reach - the reach for the projectile shot by the new FlyingMonster
      distantAttackSpeed - the speed to which the new FlyingMonster will attack by shooting
      tearAnimationSprite - the tear animation used when it dies
      tearImagePath - the tear initial image

  • Method Details

    • legalMove

      public boolean legalMove​(Vector2 position)
      Checks if the move is legal or not, it checks if the FlyingMonster collides with any wall or Door, if it is then it returns false, otherwise returns false.
      Overrides:
      legalMove in class NonStaticObject
      Parameters:
      position - , object position
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal, false otherwise.
